text:
Washington Bridge, spanning the Harlem River, from upper Manhattan; at (West 181st Street and Amsterdam Ave), to the Bronx. The photographers vantage point is in the latter and he is viewing towards the former. About 1932.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Bridges - Washington Bridge [spanning the Harlem River from upper Manhattan at West 181st Street and Amsterdam Avenue to the Bronx.]

text:
The George Washington Bridge, a steel structure, connecting Manhattan at West 181st Street with Fort Lee, New Jersey. The view is westward from Manhattan, and just south of the Bridge. Control of this engineering masterpiece, is in the hands of the N.Y. Port Authority, who will charge a toll for crossing same. These 4 views are more or less similar, and are all by the same photographer.

1936.

Walter L. Bogert.
title: Bridges - George Washington Bridge - [Connecting Manhattan at West 181st Street with Fort Lee, New Jersey.]

text:
Washington Bridge, spanning the Harlem River and connecting W. 181st Street, Manhattan (left), with the Bronx. The views are north from High Bridge.

June 20, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Washington Bridge - Harlem River - [High Bridge.]

title: Bridges - Washington Bridge - Harlem River - [High Bridge.]
